alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 8:35PM PST until December 28 at 5:11AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Nehalem River near Vernonia affecting Columbia County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nehalem River near Vernonia. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...Above 12.0 feet, expect minor flooding of low-lying areas in and near Vernonia. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:20 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 12.0 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage overnight. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 515 AM PST.
